alert.note: Alert for Jones; Monroe; Taylor (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 30 at 5:37AM EDT until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central, southeast, and west central Georgia, including the following counties, in central Georgia, Baldwin, Bibb, Bleckley, Crawford, Crisp, Dodge, Dooly, Houston, Jasper, Jones, Laurens, Monroe, Montgomery, Peach, Pulaski, Putnam, Telfair, Twiggs, Wheeler, Wilcox and Wilkinson. In east central Georgia, Emanuel, Glascock, Greene, Hancock, Jefferson, Johnson, Taliaferro, Treutlen, Warren, Washington and Wilkes. In southeast Georgia, Toombs. In west central Georgia, Macon, Marion, Schley, Sumter, Taylor and Webster. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - As Hurricane Idalia moves inland, heavy rainfall is expected in portions of central and eastern Georgia. Rainfall amounts of 4 to 9 inches are expected in the swath of highest accumulations, and isolated amounts of up to 10 inches are possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
